duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct legal research and writing for attorney and case preparation.
Investigate the facts of cases for case preparation and interview witnesses and clients in preparation for trial.
Draft legal documents for attorney review and assists in the preparation of cases for submission to the Immigration Courts, USCIS, and the National Visa Center.
Monitor the status of pending cases at USCIS and National Visa Center, and call Immigration Courts for information regarding pending motions, court hearings, etc.
Assist with the law firm’s case acceptance process, meeting with clients to collect information and documents required for case submission.
Provide clients with case specific questionnaires and follow-up with clients on the status of questionnaires.
Assist Legal Secretary and Receptionist with administrative tasks as needed, including file maintenance, translation, interpretation, and other related duties.
Review files for upcoming applications, update addresses, determine any outstanding balances, and provide translation and interpretation for non-English speaking clients.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree is required. Two or more years’ experience working in a law firm is required.
